result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Laroy Ivory

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory not in court, in custody at Dodge.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Derrick Laroy Ivory.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense has received discovery and an offer and needs to review with client.  Defense request another scheduling conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Derrick Laroy Ivory.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense has received discovery, but no offer and request an adjourned date.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense 

- signed by the Court (electronically)

Attorney Thomas Harris appeared in court, advised the Court that he met with defendant earlier today and accepted the appointment, however requests that preliminary hearing be rescheduled to 1:30 p.m. on July 20.

Deputy clerk in contact with preliminary court; hearing rescheduled to 1:30 p.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 15:

Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory, Pro Se, in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Counsel has not yet been appointed as to this case.

Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Thomas Harris to represent defendant at the rate of $125 per hour;  Attorney Harris NOT present in court but will be contacted by the deputy clerk as to the appointment. 

Court did not make finding whether defendant to repay the County; to be addressed at a future court hearing.

Court ordered case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  

Clerk:  jms
OSPD Appointment of counsel report received and filed
Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 15:

Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory in court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed.  Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Statements to the Court by defense counsel.
State is requesting more detail be filed as to the number of attempts made contacting counsel.

Court adjourns for CAUSE and adjourns for an additional 10 days to allow the Public Defender additional time to appoint counsel.

Judge Sanders will conduct the next hearing.  Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory not in court, defendant in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Derrick Laroy Ivory in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derrick Laroy Ivory appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
     99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Floyd W.S. Jr;; Shawnesha P.T. and her children
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
